project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Users are not able to distinguish between custom fields of same type and name when adding them to screen
!screenshot.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of only displaying a name, also display ID or some other identifier to allow users to distinguish the custom fields

h3. Why This Is Important
# Jira currently allows users to create multiple custom fields of same type and name. A suggestion to disallow this is not yet implemented [JRASERVER-61376 - Prevent duplicate field creation|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61376]. 
# It's not possible to create multiple context to be associated with the same project [JRASERVER-6851 - Allow more than one custom field context to be associated with the same project but different issue types|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-6851]

Due to the above, it wouldn't be uncommon to create multiple custom fields of the same type with the same name

h3. Workaround
* Rename a custom field and to be able to distinguish them when adding them to a screen
fields.summary: Show Custom field id when we are adding custom field onto project screens

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Our Jira instance is synchronized with three User Directories in three different domains that means they in different countries.

So we faced an issue when user with username 'Jack' has moved from one country to another, thus his new account was created in another domain with the same username 'Jack'.

As we know Jira sync multiple directories one by one from the top. So when it find username in the first directory it does ignore the same username from second directory.

So 'Jack' was not able to login Jira until we renamed his account in the first directory to 'Jack2').

(FYI https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-multiple-directories-938847057.html)

Would it be possible to improve working with multiple directories so users won't have issues when they try to login from another directory?


Thank you!
fields.summary: Add ability to sync the same usernames from different User Directories

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In this issue we want to gather feedback from customers about current behaviour of mentions/assignees. 

h1. Description
In Jira 8.19.1 we change method for searching users in mentions and assignees to improve Jira performance and reliability. Due to this changes list of users is generated based on permission scheme level and in result the list can contains users that are not assignable/mentionable because of other permissions.

h1. What changed and why
h3. Changes
Since Jira 8.19.1 user lookup method for assignee and mentions became faster on large instances and keeps decent performance with scale. We achieve that by changing search method and now users are searched based on {{permission schemes}}. It allows us make huge performance improvement, but we also need to introduce a few limitations. The introduction of these changes was conscious and driven by the need to ensure the stability and the best possible performance of Jira, regardless of the size of the instance.

h3. Limitations
Any other filtering-out options outside of permission schemes are no longer respected. In result list of users, returned during attempt to assign or mention someone, can contains users that shouldn't be there. But it only applies to the returned list, we still make validations during saving such mention or assignee.

For example when we try to mention user in issue who has no permission to see this one due to some issue security level, we can do that but such user won't get any notification nor see the issue. 
Also when we try to assign user that has no permission to be assigned due to e.g. ProjectPermissionOverrides, the operation will fail. 

h1. Possible solutions
Here are couple of ways we consider, as improvement of UX in case the limitations prove to be significant inconvenience. Implemented in order to avoid situations when returned list will contains user which cannot be assignable/mentionable. 
# Keep invalid users on the returned list, but marked them as not selectable.
# Stop showing such users. It would result in being some searches being empty, as long as username query will be long enough to point to a user which is not filtered out but such conditions.
# Make sure we will not make as many calls until the unfiltered list contains some max number users as we are back to the performance problems before our changes

h1. Available workarounds
To achieve similar behaviour as before our changes, required permissions can be configured on permission schemes level as well.
fields.summary: Permission filtering in mentions/assignees suggestions are based only on permission schemes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Today any users that wish for a 'Time for status' gadget or report need to rely on third-party apps. That functionality could be useful for many users who need this information.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a native dashboard and report that shows that, it could be based on [Jira Charting Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/288/jira-charting-plugin?tab=overview&hosting=server], an free app by Atlassian Labs that today is unsupported and is not getting new updates.


h3. Workaround 

The only workaround today would be using third-party paid apps, like:
 * [Time in Status|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211756/time-in-status?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview]
 * [Time in status - SLA -Timer - Stopwatch for Jira DC/Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220908/time-in-status-sla-timer-stopwatch-for-jira-dc-cloud?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview]
 * [Status Time Reports|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221826/status-time?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview]

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the "Created vs Resolved Chart" it will not display the last week under circumstances.
Circumstances:
* Set "Days previously" to > 150 days
* Display the Trend of Unresolved
* Set Layout of Dashboard to more than 1 column

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard with more than one column
 # Add the "Created vs Resolved Chart" Gadget to the Dashboard
 # Set any filter
 # Set period to Weekly
 # Set Days Previously to i.e. 360
 # Display the Trend of Unresolved set to yes
 # other values can stay as default
 # save the gadget configuration
 # now the last week should be displayed
 # (hard)refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
The same last week results should still be there

h3. Actual Results
The last entry point is now a week earlier

h3. Workaround
Use single column display in the dashboard
fields.summary: Gadget "Created vs Resolved" misses last week when using more than 150 days past and >1 column layout

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We have patters of issues related to sub-tasks where the system fields Affected Version and Fixed version are involved.
# System fields relates to Versions (Affected & Fixed) are displayed on sub-tasks view even when they are not part of any screen (create/edit/view).
# These fields are not inheriting values from parent issues and are simply displayed as NULL.
# Users are able to bulk edit these values even when edit issue screen is not enabled with these fields.
# When converting an issue type (Ex: User Story) with Version fields (Affected & Fixed) values set into a sub-task, these version fields are not emptied even though these fields are not part of the sub-task issue type screens in use.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *TEST* project for validation of these patterns.
 # Create a separate screen-scheme for "*sub-task*" issue type and remove both fields "*Affected Versions* & *Fixed Version*" from field configurations and link it with "*TEST*" project for sub-task issue type.
 # Create a parent issue with/without "*Versions(Affected &Fixed)*" (by changing screen fields) and later create sub-tasks. Both Version fields (Affected & Fixed) appear on the sub-tasks view, so it is not respecting the fields configured as part of the screens in use. Though create and edit sub-tasks doesn't show these fields, view sub-task has appearance of both fields.
 # Now try and perform bulk edit operations on the Version fields for sub-tasks. Bulk edit of version fields for sub-task can be performed even when they are not part of the create/edit screen for sub-tasks.
 # Try converting an issue (user story for example) with Version fields (Affected & Fixed) set to a value into a sub-task, the Version fields retain the values even though these are not part of the issue type screens in use.
 # Try set-up Kanban boards to understand the effect of hiding the fields. Indeed the effect of [JSWSERVER-11315|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11315] can be felt. However, as the specific functionality is based on the implementation of JQL functionality - that hidden fields would not participate in JQL/issue index searches. This demands users to have the functionality to ensure that sub-task issues respect the configured screen-scheme in use.

h3. Expected Results
 # The Version fields (Affected and Fixed) shouldn't appear in the sub-task view when they are not part of the screens used.
 # Users should be able to edit these fields as long as they are not part of Create/Edit sub-task screens.
 # When another issues having these fields is converted into sub-task, these fields shouldn't appear as long as they are not part of the create/edit sub-task screens and should only be retained if they are part of the create/edit sub-task screens.
 # Users should be able to overcome the effect of [JSWSERVER-11315|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11315] instead of hiding the fields as an alternative. It is possible with the workaround at the moment listed in the request but fixing this pattern will permanently address this.

h3. Actual Results
 # The Version fields (Affected and Fixed) appear in the sub-task view even when they are not part of the screens used.
 # Users are able to bulkedit these fields even when they are not part of Create/Edit sub-task screens.
 # When other issue-type having Version fields is converted into sub-task, these fields appear even when they are not part of the create/edit sub-task screens and the values from previous issue-type are retained.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: System fields Affected Version and Fixed version appear in the sub-task view even when they are not part of any screens and also bulkedit is possible for these fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The customer noticed below performance issue when they do performance test via [Data Center App Performance Toolkit|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/marketplace/dc-apps-performance-toolkit-user-guide-jsm/] for Jira software.
 * *Showing project side bar is slow in high load, when there is no board set for the project.*

In the method of findFirstRapidViewByProject, it seems all boards search is triggered though no board is set for a project.
[https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JSWSERVER/repos/jira-software-application/browse/[…]/greenhopper/service/rapid/ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.java|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JSWSERVER/repos/jira-software-application/browse/jira-software-plugins/jira-agile/greenhopper/src/main/java/com/atlassian/greenhopper/service/rapid/ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.java#65]

*Is it necessary to do all boards search, when board is not yet set for a project?* If all boards search is skipped, the performance should be better.

The customer also tested when below plugins are disabled (JSWSERVER-16717) . The slowness was not observed.
 * project-sidebar-header-boards-list-provider
 * board-scope-filter

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  performance test via [Data Center App Performance Toolkit|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/marketplace/dc-apps-performance-toolkit-user-guide-jsm/]

h3. Expected Results

No slowness happened for projects without board
h3. Actual Results

Slowness is obverved for projects without board in performance test.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Slowness on project sidebar for the projects without board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem

After clicking the "Assign" button or pressing Jira shortcut "a" (assign) the pop-up screen already shows with the cursor on the comment section instead of highlighting the Assignee fields.
Same user refreshes the screen and clicks the "Assign" button or pressing Jira shortcut "a" (assign) will result in the "cursor" on the Assignee dropdown.

Attached a recording to better explain the issue.
h3. Environment

8.13.X (doesn't happen on 8.14.0+. Confirmed it doesn't happen on 8.20.2 as well)
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*1.* On any given issue, click the "Add comment" button and select "Text" as editing mode.
 * This causes the {{jira.editor.user.mode}} property for the given user to change from "wysiwyg" to "source". This field is updated every time you switch modes.

*2.* Close the browser, reopen and revisit the same issue.

*3.* Click the "Assign" button or pressing Jira shortcut "a" (assign).
h3. Expected Results

Cursor highlights the Assignee field.
h3. Actual Results

Cursor is presented already in the comment section.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the screen.
h3. Notes

This issue no longer happens on 8.14.0 as it was fixed after the UI overhaul done on 8.14 (see [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-14-x-release-notes-1027133861.html])

The property can be fetched for a given user using the following query:
{code:sql}
 select pe.id, pe.property_key, au.lower_user_name, ps.propertyvalue
from app_user au
join propertyentry pe
  on au.id = pe.entity_id
join propertystring ps
  on pe.id = ps.id where pe.property_key='jira.editor.user.mode' and au.lower_user_name;
{code}
fields.summary: Cursor jumps to comment instead of assignee field if "Text" mode was previously selected on comment

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Editing a Text field using gg or "." in Text Mode results in the text cursor being stuck on the Hide Toolbar menu. The cursor does not select the text box to allow users to type automatically.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Open any issue with Multiline texts - Description, Comments, etc
 # Type gg -> Add Comment (Can also be Description, any Multiline Text Custom Field that has wiki mode)
# Ensure *Text* is selected instead of *Visual*  - The issue did not happen in Visual Mode
 # The text box was opened and the Hide Toolbar button (Toggle visibility) was selected
 # The cursor did not move on to the Text box as expected (Recording attached) 

h3. Expected Results
To have the cursor automatically go to the text box when selecting to edit a field text, as it happens in Visual Mode.

h3. Actual Results
The input cursor is stuck on Hide toolbar and the user needs to click inside the field to start editing.



h3. Workaround
As a temporary measure, select the Visual Mode
fields.summary: Editing a Text field using gg or "." in Text Mode results in the text cursor stuck on the Hide Toolbar menu

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
$user_name displayed in Activity Stream for gitlab commits

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure DVCS in Jira 
 # Have users from Gitlab commit changesets into Jira issues

h3. Expected Results
User names are properly displayed, linked to their commits on the Activity Stream

h3. Actual Results
$user_name is displayed for commits from gitlab in the activity stream, link on it correctly sends to user gitlab profile:

 !image-2021-12-03-15-57-53-031.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
As a Jira user would be nice to be able to remove "hints" from editing the table in the Visual view of the description of an issue.
It is confusing for customers and also appears sometimes just on the first row of the column itself.
fields.summary: Remove "hints" from editing the table in visual view of Description

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary 
h3. JIRA DC doesn't resolve issues with status, instead, it's just a link, whilst JIRA cloud resolves the link in the description with status
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Jira 
 # Create issue 
 # Paste an issue link in the description
 # Save 

h3. Expected Results

Jira DC should also resolve the link just like Jira cloud. 
h3. Actual Results

Jira DC doesn't resolve the link, instead, it's just a link 

 

Cloud -
!image-2021-12-02-18-15-16-860.png|width=244,height=130!

DC - 

 

!image-2021-12-02-18-16-03-493.png|width=262,height=134!
fields.summary: Inserting an Issue link into an issue description field doesn't resolve the link

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Links to repositories are lowercased which can create problems when the repository name has a mixed case. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create repository "Test"
 # Synchronize the repository

h3. Expected Results

DVCS uses "Test" as a repository name while creating a link.
h3. Actual Results

DVCS uses lowercased "test" as a repository name while creating a link. It can result in a 404 error if Github/Gitlab/Bitbucket doesn't support a mixed case.

fields.description:
*Information beforehand:*

We are using Jira Server 8.20.2 with Gitlab, utilizing the DVCS connector. This will add commit information inside Jira cases.

*Problem:*

If you create an activity stream in Jira and set some filters, there is no option to exclude the commits in different cases. This leads to a flood of activity stream items, which are not wanted.

That the commits are shown in the activity stream does make sense, because it is interpreted as an update inside certain cases. But the possibility to filter them out is missing.

*Humble request:*

Would it be possible to introduce one more filter for the activity stream? As mentioned, one to exclude commit updates inside the Activity filter category.

 

Thanks for your time!

Cheers,

Dominique
fields.summary: Possibility to filter out commits in activity streams

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When performing a search for issues in list view, and then using the "..." menu to the right of the issue to update the status, the first issue in the search results will be updated in the seatch immediately. But other issues in the results will not have their status updated in the search, only the first in the list.

The status of the issue are actually updated in the system, so when you refresh the search, the status of the issues are displayed correctly. But when you update them while in the search, only the first issue in the list of issues will be updated in the search.

This behaviour has been seen in both versions 8.13.8 and 8.20.1 so it probably exists in between these versions and, possibly, further back.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Jira Software project with sample data. Call it 'Test' with key 'TEST'
# Go to *Search* > *Search for issues*
# Switch to Advanced search and make sure to change the view to List
# Ensure that the column 'Status' is currently displayed in the search results
# Run a search with the following JQL: "{{project = TEST}}"
# Hover over the *very first* issue in the list to see the '...' menu to the right of the issue and click on it.
# Change the status of the menu to something which isn't the issue's current status.
# Observe that the status immediately changes in the search results.
# Hover over the *second* issue in the list to see the '...' menu to the right of the issue and click on it.
# Change the status of the menu to something which isn't the issue's current status.

h3. Expected Results
Given the behaviour of the previous issue, the status should be updated live in the search results.

h3. Actual Results
The status of the issue is not updated in the search results, but the status is updated in the system and refreshing the search will update the status accordingly.

There are no errors displayed in any log files (including http access logs) and generating a .har file does not display any errors.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Updating an issue status on issue search page doesn't update the search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When upgrading Jira to a version that runs DVCS upgrade task To_17_AddRepositoryUrl or To_18_ShorteningRepositoryUrlColumn, the upgrade can be delayed while the upgrade task runs, with little logging provided as to the progress taken.

The upgrade task iterates over organizations and repositories, so, the performance scales directly with the amount of these.

The only logging written is when the upgrade task starts, and finishes. There is no progress or "batching" style behaviour exhibited. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira instance, eg 8.13.0, on MySQL 5.7.22
 # Link hundreds of repositories and/or organisations
 # Now, start a ZDU upgrade to version that utilises upgrade task To_17 or To_18 (EG, Jira 8.17.1)

 
h3. Expected Results

The upgrade task completes quickly. 

At a minimum, the upgrade task provides verbose logging to indicate progress is occurring.
h3. Actual Results

The upgrade task takes some time to complete, with very little logging.
{code:java}
2021-07-29 23:25:08,394+0000 active-objects-init-JiraTenantImpl{id='system'}-0 INFO anonymous     [c.a.j.p.d.activeobjects.v3.To_17_AddRepositoryUrl] upgrade [ 17 ]: starting
...
2021-07-30 02:41:20,543+0000 active-objects-init-JiraTenantImpl{id='system'}-0 INFO anonymous     [c.a.j.p.d.activeobjects.v3.To_17_AddRepositoryUrl] upgrade [ 17 ]: finished
{code}

From a thread point of view, the AO initialization thread is long running with the following stack:
{code}
"active-objects-init-JiraTenantImpl{id='system'}-0" #192 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f8faa786000 nid=0x2b40 runnable [0x00007f8e8570f000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
...
	at com.mysql.jdbc.util.ReadAheadInputStream.read(ReadAheadInputStream.java:174)
	- locked <0x00000006ad989de8> (a com.mysql.jdbc.util.ReadAheadInputStream)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.readFully(MysqlIO.java:3008)
...
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeLargeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:5104)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:1998)
...
	at net.java.ao.EntityProxy.save(EntityProxy.java:574)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.activeobjects.v3.To_17_AddRepositoryUrl.upgrade(To_17_AddRepositoryUrl.java:36)
...
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectUpgradeManagerImpl.upgrade(ActiveObjectUpgradeManagerImpl.java:34)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.DataSourceProviderActiveObjectsFactory.upgrade(DataSourceProviderActiveObjectsFactory.java:84)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.AbstractActiveObjectsFactory.create(AbstractActiveObjectsFactory.java:65)
...
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: DVCS upgrade tasks To_17_AddRepositoryUrl and To_18_ShorteningRepositoryUrlColumn run slowly with a large amount of repositories and organizations, with no progress logged

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When sprint has been completed before it was planned to, it cannot be edited.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create sprint with startDate set for a future date.
 # Add an issue to the sprint.
 # Start the sprint.
 # Complete the sprint.
 # Go to the "Sprint Report".
 # Try to edit the goal or name of the completed sprint.

h3. Expected Results

The sprint is edited.
h3. Actual Results

Error is being shown: "The start date of a sprint must be before the completion date". Edit is not possible.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This suggestion is a request to reopen (or extend) JSWSERVER-6949

Although the issue was closed, the resolution did not reflect the recent requests. 

The ticket was closed on Aug 6, 2021 with the update that search capability had been added, but all of the recent requests were related to ability to apply quick-filters to the epics pane.

As a use-case: We have a number of subteams (potentially based on components) within our boards, and usually have a couple dozen epics in progress on a board at any one time, but only a fraction of them (5-6) are relevant to any one subteam. We already use quick-filters to create sub-team views of the board, which does work very well for issues but not for the epics pane. 

Hence why I believe the solution many people are looking for is not the ability to search the epics pane, but the ability to apply the quick-filters we already have and use for issues to the epics pane...

Similar expressions are also found in the cloud version, JSWCLOUD-18474, but also by noting the descriptions for all the suggestions that were marked duplicate of the original JSWSERVER-6949 (ie. JSWSERVER-6962, JSWSERVER-7174, JSWSERVER-7990, JSWSERVER-8102)
fields.summary: Apply Quick-Filters to Epics in Backlog Pane

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you complete an active sprint (selecting the option to 'Move open issues to: $sprintN) with issue(s) in a status that includes the property "jira.issue.editable=false," then:
* JIRA throws the error: "This issue cannot be edited because of its workflow status." 
* Clicking "Cancel" is the only way to get the 'Complete sprint' popup to go away.
* The sprint is completed/closed.
* All issues in the completed sprint are moved to the backlog; not just the uneditable issues

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using the Software Simplified Workflow, add a new status called "In Review"
# Add the "jira.issue.editable=false" property to the status
# Create two issues and two sprints
# Add the two issues to the first sprint and start it.
# Transition one of the issues into "In Review" status
# Complete the first sprint and select the option to 'Move open issues to: <select second sprint>'

h3. Expected Results
*Either*
1) The first sprint fails to close until the uneditable issue moved into a status where it is editable...    

*OR*

2) The first sprint is closed and only the uneditable issues are moved to the backlog.  The editable issues are moved into the new sprint.

h3. Actual Results
The sprint is closed and all issues (editable and uneditable) are moved to the backlog instead of the new sprint.

The below error is thrown in the UI:
{noformat}
This issue cannot be edited because of its workflow status.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Completing a sprint with uneditable issues throws an error and moves all unresolved issues into the backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Github offers to [secure repositories webhooks |https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhooks/securing-your-webhooks] with a secret.Jira currently discards the headers HTTP_X_HUB_SIGNATURE_256 and HTTP_X_HUB_SIGNATURE causing any unidentified payload to trigger a Jira soft sync.
h3. Suggested Solution

_Take into consideration jira's HTTP_X_HUB_SIGNATURE_256 if the user chooses to define it._

_Either set a secret for webhooks on account creation in the DVCS menu so the value will be populated in all the repositories or allow to define a secret value after the creation._
h3. Why This Is Important

Even that the impact of triggering a soft sync from an unknown webhook payload doesn't break anything it's still a security vulnerability if an unknown party can run an administrative task in an unauthorized manner.
fields.summary: JIRA Server - GitHub integration

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When the board filter specifies a certain issue type, and the project is associated with multiple workflows, there are statuses that will have *exclamation marks* to indicate the statuses that exist in one workflow but not the other workflow. These statuses will disappear from the board when they're listed under unmapped status. *The problem happens as, by default, all statuses will be listed under the unmapped status column when the board is created for that project with multiple workflows.*

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Have project using 2 different workflows
#* let's say 1 workflow for Epic, 1 workflow for story/bug/task/sub-task
# Create a board with filter
{code}
project = ABC and ("Epic Name" = ABC-123 OR "Epic Link" = ABC-123) order by rank
{code}
# Check column management page

h4. Expected Result
All statuses will be listed under the unmapped status column, the admin can then map them to the intended column.

h4. Actual Result
The unmapped status column will only show statuses that exist on both workflows. The statuses that exist in one workflow but not the other workflow will disappear from the board.

h4. Workaround
# Set the board filter to only specify project
{code}
project = ABC order by rank
{code}
# Check column management page
# Map all statuses (listed under unmapped status column) to the intended column (To Do, In Progress, Done, etc)
# Update board filter to
{code}
project = ABC and (key = ABC-123 OR "Epic Link" = ABC-123) order by rank
{code}
# This way, the statuses that exist in one workflow but not the other workflow will remain shown on column management page with exclamation marks, but will not disappear.
fields.summary: When a board uses multiple workflows and board filter specifies certain issue types, column management page only shows statuses that exist on both workflows.

fields.description:
Creating a branch from Jira results in a “401” error if the user creating the branch does not have permission on the Bitbucket project defined as “Primary Link” under Jira (Project Links).

*Steps to Reproduce:* 
 * Configure an Application Link between Jira and Bitbucket
 * Create two projects in Bitbucket (For Example - BBProj1 and BBProj2) 
 * Create a test user in Jira who has access to only one of the Bitbucket Project (BBProj1)
 * Add both the Projects as Project Links in Jira by browsing through the Jira Projects’ settings -> Project Links 
 * Make the Project (BBProj2) as the Primary Link project in Jira by accessing the Jira Projects’ settings -> Project Links -> Select “BBProj2” -> “Make Primary Link”
 * Now, as the test user created above, access a Jira issue and click on “Create Branch” from the Development Panel 
 * The “Create Branch” operation results in a “401” error (This is expected as the user does not have permission on the BBProj2 Bitbucket project

*Bussiness Justification:*

 There can be scenarios wherein an admin adds the Bitbucket Projects under Jira as Project links and sets up one of the Bitbucket projects as the “Primary Link”. 
 As per the documentation -  [Configuring Project links across Applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/configuring-project-links-across-applications-976171951.html], it is expected that “*When you create a feature branch from Jira, repositories from a linked Jira project will be prioritized in the list of repositories*.”  

However, due to restrictions, it's not possible to provide all users access to the Bitbucket Project that is set as “Primary Link” in Jira, and in such cases when the user creates a branch it directly fails with the “401” error.

 Hence, the request is to provide an option to choose the “repository” while creating a branch when there is a “Primary Link” configured.
fields.summary: The "Create Branch" operation in Jira should provide an option to choose the Bitbucket repository even while having a Primary Project link.

fields.description:
h3. Problem
As a system administrator, I need the ability to easily synchronize the users and groups from Azure AD in Jira when using Azure SSO.

h3. Suggested Solution
_Synchronize users from Azure AD into Jira User Directory automatically so that the system administrator will not have to do it manually_

h3. Why This Is Important
_In a company with hundreds of users, it is impossible for system administrators to manually add individual users to Jira each time they need to be created. As of today, this can be easily achieved when using AD or LDAP, but not when using Azure AD for SSO, whereas per the process, the users must be created first in Jira's user directory for then be able to login through SSO_

h3. Workaround
_Manually create users in Jira's user directory OR use third-party apps_
fields.summary: Automatic Azure User Creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inline editing for dates in Versions panel for any version does not work. Clicking the date does not show input correctly. 
Problem is reproducible in the 8.19.0+ versions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Backlog
 # Expand Versions (left) side panel
 # Choose any version
 # Click on date field either for Start Date or Release date

h3. Expected Results
 * Inline edit input appears where user can enter date
 * Presented in attachment   [^Screen Recording 2021-10-06 at 16.33.21.mov] 

h3. Actual Results
 * Inline edit does not work, it's not even displayed
 * Clicking it twice makes some refresh happening but nothing changes
 * Presented in attachment [^Screen Recording 2021-10-06 at 16.32.25.mov]

h3. Workaround
* Change dates at "Project settings > Releases" page
* Dates can be altered through the REST API with setting the dates as follow in the body:
{code:java}
releaseDate: "30/Oct/22"
startDate: "29/Oct/21"
{code}
Sample request:
{code:java}
<JIRA_URL>/jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/versions/<version_id>
method: POST
body:
    id: <version_id>
    description: "description"
    name: <version_name>
    projectId: <project_id>
    releaseDate: "20/Oct/21"
    startDate: "6/Oct/21"

{code}
fields.summary: Inline edit does not work in Backlog view for date fields in Versions panel

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a project responsible I want that my supplier users in their project on a common instance see that links towards my internal projects on the same instance where they do not have access to exist.

Currently users can only see links towards projects where they have access. Those links have all the necessary and helpfull details like the Summary or Status. Links to projects without access are simply not shown for those users.

Big development projects (2000+ Devs) include often external suppliers who are not allowed to see everything. So a network of projects with linked issues exists. One project for demands, one project for development tasks, one for budgeting, one for outsourced tasks, etc.
A supplier should not see any details of a link to an issue in a project without access. Still it is necessary to see that there is a link. As projects represent broader topics, it might show that a test was generated, or budgeting is in progress. Simply because the link shows something like "BUDGET-1234  (no access)".
fields.summary: Show issue links that point towards projects where the user has no access

fields.summary: Add the possibility to create fixed custom sprint durations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Duplicate or multiple notifications might sometimes come up when modifying an issue single time only
h3. Steps to Reproduce

One way to reproduce:
 # Create an issue and a sub-task on that issue
 # Open that issue and click on the sub-task within that issue
 # Click 'Back' button in the browser to go back to the parent case
 # HIt 'Edit' button, perform any modification and save

h3. Expected Results

Only single notification should come up, like this:

  !image-2021-09-30-10-09-05-674.png|width=313,height=80!
h3. Actual Results

Instead duplicate (or sometimes even triplicate) notification will come up

!image-2021-09-30-09-55-52-902.png|width=314,height=124,thumbnail!

!image-2021-09-30-10-08-38-193.png|width=312,height=204!
h3. Workaround

There's currently no workaround for this issue
fields.summary: Duplicate (or multiple) UI (tooltip like) notification on single time edits

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there are circumstances where the DVCS plugin from Jira will fail to create a WebHook for certain repositories. When this happens, an INFO log entry can be populated:
{noformat}
INFO ServiceRunner     [c.a.j.p.dvcs.service.RepositorySyncServiceImpl] Error when adding webhooks for repository https://github.com/test 
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.exception.SourceControlException$PostCommitHookRegistrationException: Could not add webhook. Possibly due to lack of admin permissions.
{noformat}

In this situation, Jira normally won't add any information to the application logs, unless the logging level for DVCS is manually changed.

h3. Suggested Solution

Populate the same information as a WARN or ERROR entry.
fields.summary: Log a WARN or ERROR message when DVCS fails to create WebHooks

As a global admin that **manages an enterprise instance, I need the ability to choose which users can edit components and versions/releases without granting all admin rights. So that I can better enforce role based access controls and the principle of least privilege.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Symptom

Since Jira 8.4.0 having support for Aurora, Jira is causing errors on database logging side for AURORA_VERSION() check every hour.

This does not have an impact on the application but can fill database logging if the database is not Postgres Aurora on AWS.
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Install Jira 8.4+
 # Use any database that is not Postgres Aurora
 # Check logging on database side.

h4. Expected results

No logging about Aurora
h4. Actual results

Error -
{code:java}
ERROR: function aurora_version() does not exist at character 8
HINT: No function matches the given name and argument types. You might need to add explicit type casts.
{code}
or
{code:java}
'AURORA_VERSION' is not a recognized built-in function name
{code}
This is thrown by SQL that is run every hour -
{code:java}
select AURORA_VERSION() as aurora_version;
{code}
h4. Workaround

none at this time, the error message can be ignored. 
Suppression can only be done on database side for now.
fields.summary: AURORA_VERSION check on non aurora database logged error every hour

While devloping a custom Jira plugin which contains a REST Resource.
There is a need to document this REST resources with the Atlassian REST API Browser(RAB) via JavaDoc comments. 
Sadly those JavaDoc tags/descriptions are not showing up in the RAB.

According to the following document adding tagged Javadoc comments should be enough:
https://developer.atlassian.com/server/framework/atlassian-sdk/documenting-your-apis-with-the-atlassian-rest-api-browser/

h3. Steps to Reproduce
NA

h3. Expected Results
The prototype to show (at least) the following items in the RAB:
- method description
- response body

h3. Actual Results
RAB to show method description and response body.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Issue Summary

When someone attempt to search for mention or for assignee by third or following part of display name, returned result differ than what can be expected. For example we cannot search for user {{Atlassian Jira User}} by {{User}}.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

DVCS connector incorrectly maps the authors of merge requests. The bug doesn't affect commits' authors and reviewers.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two GitLab users with the same Full Name.
 # Create a merge request with user A.
 # Create another merge request with user B.
 # Synchronize merge requests.

h3. Expected Results

Both synchronized merge requests show correct authors in the development panel.
h3. Actual Results

Synchronized merge requests show incorrect authors in the development panel.
h3. Workaround

Do not use the same full names for GitLab users.
To fix the incorrectly mapped names, replace the full names stored in the column "Author" in the table "AO_E8B6CC_PULL_REQUEST" with usernames.
fields.summary: DVCS synchronisation with GitLab is mapping users with the same full name incorrectly.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If an active Node is stuck running the a MailProcessorExecutor job, new nodes will not be able to come online and join the cluster.

This behaviour similar, but *different* from https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-data-center-functionalities-loss-due-to-cluster-wide-lock-942860754.html
* In the above article, the lock is lost. In this situation, a lock is not lost and very active. But the MailProcessorExecutor job itself is stuck.

h3. Note
The purpose for this ticket is for Jira to better handle node startups, even if a lock is "working as intended" and held by another node.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have *Node1* actively trying to run the a MailProcessorExecutor job for a long period of time.
 # Confirm that it is holding the clusterlock:
{code}
jira=> SELECT * FROM clusterlockstatus WHERE locked_by_node IS NOT NULL;


   id   |                                     lock_name                                      | locked_by_node | update_time
--------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------+---------------
 10331 | com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.services.MailProcessorExecutor:executor | Node1           | 1628812328397
{code}
 # Start *Node2*

h3. Expected Results
*Node2* is able to come online. Another node processing mail should not prevent new nodes from coming online.

h3. Actual Results
* *Node2* seems to get stuck during startup
* Checking the "Cluster Monitoring" page, we see that *Node2* shows:
** Node Status is Active
** Application Status is blank
* Thread dumps shows that Node2's startup is WAITING:
{code}
"localhost-startStop-1" #30 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f9ff4001800 nid=0x9657 waiting on condition [0x00007fa054f9a000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (sleeping)
	at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)
	at com.atlassian.beehive.db.DatabaseClusterLock.sleep(DatabaseClusterLock.java:621)
	at com.atlassian.beehive.db.DatabaseClusterLock.uninterruptibleWait(DatabaseClusterLock.java:127)
	at com.atlassian.beehive.db.DatabaseClusterLock.lock(DatabaseClusterLock.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.ManagedLocks$ManagedLockImpl.withLock(ManagedLocks.java:319)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.services.AtlassianSchedulerFacade.runWithAllLocks(AtlassianSchedulerFacade.java:126)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issues created via an issue collector using the French translation will not render the text *Adresse électronique* in bold, due to a typo in the translated string.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure your Jira instance is set to use French as the default language.
# Create an issue collector and embed it into an HTML file.
# Open the HTML file in a browser.
# Fill the fields and post the form.

h3. Expected Results
The text *Adresse électronique* in the newly created issue description is correctly rendered in bold, as shown in the image below:
 !expected.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The text is not rendered in bold, as there's a whitespace between the last character and the asterisk used for bold markup:
!actual.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
(!) *The following procedure is unsupported and not recommended, as it involves customizing Jira's code.*
* Follow the steps in the KB article below to manually modify, upload and install the language pack:
** [Install a custom language pack for Jira server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/install-a-custom-language-pack-for-jira-server-295305642.html]
* The JAR file can be found at {{JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/jira-core-language-pack-fr_FR-8.14.0.v20200826125100.jar}}.
* The file to be modified inside the JAR is {{i18n/i18n_fr_FR.properties}}.
* The line that needs to be modified is the one below:
{noformat:none|title=}
collector.plugin.template.contact.email=*Adresse \u00e9lectronique *\: [mailto\:{0}]
{noformat}
fields.summary: String "Adresse électronique" is not properly rendered in bold in descriptions of issues created via issue collectors when using the French translation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, Jira does not know how custom fields of type AbstractSingleFieldType should be rendered in the Customers Portal or in the JQL basic mode from a saved filter. This can lead to some inconsistencies with complex custom fields of some plugins (eg Tempo).

It would be nice if Jira could render/support this type of field.
fields.summary: Add the ability to render AbstractSingleFieldType on JQL Mode
